## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/evaluator">Evaluator</a></>}>
This class evaluates LLVM IR, producing the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> representing each SSA instruction. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/evaluator/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/evaluator/mutablevalue">MutableValue</a></>}>
The evaluator represents values either as a Constant&#42;, or as a MutableAggregate, which allows changing individual aggregate elements without creating a new interned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/evaluator/mutablevalue/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evaluator/mutableaggregate">MutableAggregate</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction.  Changes to global variables are stored in a mapping that can</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fails, the evaluation object should not be reused.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If there are still users of the alloca, the program is doing something</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// silly, e.g. storing the address of the alloca somewhere and using it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Evaluate a call to function F, returning true if successful, false if we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// can&#39;t evaluate it.  ActualArgs contains the formal arguments for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// As we compute SSA register values, we store their contents here. The back</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the deque contains the current function and the stack contains the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values in the calling frames.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::deque&lt;DenseMap&lt;Value&#42;, Constant&#42;&gt;&gt; ValueStack;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is used to detect recursion.  In pathological situations we could hit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// exponential behavior, but at least there is nothing unbounded.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8fc529c79977cdd01e187986f960a07f">SmallVector&lt;Function&#42;, 4&gt;</a> CallStack;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For each store we execute, we update this map.  Loads check this to get</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the most up-to-date value.  If evaluation is successful, this state is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// committed to the process.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">  DenseMap&lt;GlobalVariable &#42;, MutableValue&gt; MutatedMemory;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// To &#39;execute&#39; an alloca, we create a temporary global variable to represent</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// its body.  This vector is needed so we can delete the temporary globals</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// when we are done.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8fc529c79977cdd01e187986f960a07f">SmallVector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;GlobalVariable&gt;</a>, 32&gt; AllocaTmps;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These global variables have been marked invariant by the static</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// constructor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">  SmallPtrSet&lt;GlobalVariable&#42;, 8&gt; Invariants;</Highlight></CodeLine>
